title: xXx Racing Hot Dog Practice Crits

address.street: East 87th Street and South Lake Shore Drive

description: Practice criteriums on closed Chicago city streets. A straightaway with wide 180 degree turns at either end.
course: 87th Street and S. Lakeshore Drive, on Chicago's southern lakefront.
registration: Registration will be managed on-site; registration is $15 regardless of the number of races participated in.
notes: Three fields during the evening, one for men, one for women, and one open. All three fields are non-competitive practice criteriums. Finish placement will not be uploaded to USAC. Races will count towards Cat 5 upgrade at USAC official's discretion.
directions: Enter "87th street and S Lakeshore Drive, Chicago" into Google Maps.

title: Lincoln Park Criterium
description: 2017 Lincoln Park Criterium presented by XXX Racing-Athletico
course: 0.8-mile (1.3km) course along Chicago lakefront near Montrose Beach on the northern end of Lincoln Park. Course features two 90-degree turns, one 180-degree turn on a 60-foot wide road, and two easy bends that riders can pedal all the way through.
registration:
Race-day registration opens at 7:00 AM and closes 20 minutes prior to each event. Pre-register online at http://xxxracing.org/lincoln-park-crit ; online registration processing fee included in the prices stated above. Day of registration will include a $10 surcharge.

A one-day USA Cycling racing license may be purchased for $10 and are only available for Cat 5 men, and Cat 4 women. Annual licenses are available starting at $70 for Adults and $35 for Juniors. Visit usacycling.org for additional information.

Register for an additional races online at xxxracing.org and receive a $15 per race discount. Pre-registration will close Wednesday April 26th at 11:59pm.
notes:
Details:
A minimum of five racers must be present for each category race to be held. Races may be shortened or combined at the discretion of the Chief Official.

Payouts:
Purse and Pay Schedule
$400 = $120/100/80/60/40
$300 = $100/75/55/45/25
$200 = $60/50/40/30/20
$125 = $35/30/25/20/15
Fixed Gear Open will have separate and equal payouts for men’s and women’s fields.
directions:
Use Lake Shore Drive and northern exits near Montrose Harbor. Parking can be accessed via Montrose Ave and Lawrence Ave. Start/Finish and registration are on the east side of the course near the Montrose Dog Beach. Parking is available along Simonds Drive north of Lawrence Ave. and south of Wilson Ave. There is no access to the course or parking available from Wilson Ave. because of construction. 

Racing rain, snow or shine. All USA Cycling rules apply. All riders must wear a helmet whenever on a bicycle at this event. For more information, please visit xxxracing.org/lincoln-park-criterium or contact Kevin O’Neill at lpc@xxxracing.org.

title: 2017 Monsters of the Midway
description:
A 1.1 km loop along the historic Midway
Plaisance. Counter-clockwise, start/finish on the
south side near Woodlawn Ave.
course:
A 1.1 km loop along the historic Midway
Plaisance. Counter-clockwise, start/finish on the
south side near Woodlawn Ave. See map here http://ucvc.uchicago.edu/Monsters.html
registration: Preregistration available at http://www.bikereg.com/. Day of registration also available.
directions: Race start line will be near Ida Noyes Hall, 1212 E. 59th Street, at the corner of North Midway Plaisance and Woodlawn.

title: Countryside Criterium presented by Autobarn of Countryside
description: Countryside Criterium presented by Autobarn of Countryside
registration:
Pre-registration at www.bikereg.com (no additional online fees). Day of registration-add $15.
Race day registration closes 20 minutes prior to each event. Race day registration opens at 07:00am.
directions:
From 294, exit 75th street and proceed West to Willow Springs Road.  Follow Willow Springs Road north to 67th Street and follow signs for parking.

From 55 North, exit Joliet Road/U.S. 66 and proceed to Willow Springs Road.  Follow Willow Springs Road south to 67th St and follow signs for parking.

From 55 South, follow exits for Wolf Rd.  Follow Wolf Road north to Joliet Road/U.S. 66.  Turn east on Joliet Road to Willow Springs Road.  Follow Willow Springs Road south to 67th St and follow signs for parking.

title: Kickapoo Bash
registration: On-site registration start at 8 AM and closes 30 minutes prior to events.  $35 for pre-reg and $35 on-site.  Juniors $20. Kids race is free.
notes: All USAC rules apply.  Chip timing courtesy of PAMBA.  Payouts for Expert Races  Shirts.  Swag.
directions: From I-74 take the Oakwood exit 206, go north, go east on Glenburn Creek Rd, through park to Kickapoo Mountain Bike Trail Head parking.

title: Half Acre Cycling's CX Eliminator
description:
For CX Eliminator, there will be a non-­elimination Seed Round, one or more Heats of eight racers who complete one 3km lap to determine Heat placement for the first Elimination Round.
● In the Elimination Rounds, Heats of eight racers again complete a 3km lap. The top four finishers move to the next round, while the bottom four are eliminated from competition.
● In the Championship Round, the final eight racers will complete the lap, head­-to-­head, with the top three racers earning podium spots.
course:
Big Marsh Bike Park. A 3 km course on grass, pavement, and gravel. There will be technical flow section, short hill climbs, singletrack, and
straightaways. Barriers and other hazards to be placed as needed, in accordance with USA Cycling regulations.
registration:
Online registration is available through BikeReg (https://www.bikereg.com/cx­eliminator).
Early registration through, Wednesday, August 23rd is $20 plus any fees. $25 plus fees thereafter.
Race­day registration will be available on­site. Registration opens at 8:00 and closes 30 minutes before the listed Start Time for each Category.
Your registration is for all races in your Category. As long as you keep winning, you keep racing. Keep in mind that your Category may be racing all day, with several Heats and several Rounds.
All racers must present a valid USA Cycling license at registration. Cat 5 men and Cat 5 women may purchase a
one­ day license for $15. Annual licenses will be available for $70, $35 for Juniors. All participants are required to sign a participation waiver, with parental or guardian endorsement required for racers under 18.
● Races run rain or shine
● NO REFUNDS
● All USA Cycling rules apply
● For more information, see http://cx­eliminator.blogspot.com/
